description: Puff is a light dough made by combining flour, water, and butter, then folding and rolling out repeatedly
During cooking the butter melts creating pockets of air, which makes the pastry is light and flaky
The butter must be kept below 16°C whilst preparing the dough
Puff pastry is used in making dishes like Croissants, Sausage Rolls, Pie, Strudel, and Turnovers
Shortcrust is a thicker dough made by rubbing together butter and flour to create large chunks, then usually shaped
The butter is kept in chunks so that it can melt to create large pockets of air
Weaker flours are preferred as they don't develop as much gluten
Shortcrust pastry is used as a base for tarts, quiches, and pies
Choux is a light dough made by combining dough and butter, then folding and rolling out repeatedly
During cooking the butter melts creating pockets of air, which makes the pastry is light and flaky
The butter must be kept below 16°C whilst preparing the dough
Choux pastry is used in French and Spanish dishes like Profiteroles, Eclairs, and Churros
Hot Water Crust is a dough made by melting butter in boiling water, the adding flour and kneading
The dough is then moulded by hand and retains its shape after cooling
Due to the high water content, hot water crust is capable of holding wet fillings
Hot Water Crust is used in making dishes like Pork Pies and Game Pies
Phllo is a very thin type of dough made by combining flour, water, and oil, then repeatedly stretching and folding
A large flat surface is required due to how large the stretched pastry becomes
In pastry-making, the layers are brushed with oil or butter before being folded
Phyllo pastry is used in Balkan and Middle-Eastern dishes like Baklava and BÃ¶rek
Flaky pastry is a simple type of pastry made by mixing together large chunks of butter and flour, then rolling and folding
The chunks of butter mean that the pastry layers remain separate and become very flaky, hence the name
Flaky pastry is commonly used for pasties, turnovers, and sausage rolls in place of Puff pastry
